abstract.p: Correction; Dec 24, 2006, headline with article about fatal vehicular accidents in New York omitted Queens, where one accident occurred

block.p: A headline with an article in some copies on Dec. 24 about the death of three people in vehicular accidents in New York omitted one of the boroughs where a fatality occurred. Besides Brooklyn and Staten Island, there was a fatality in Queens. The article also misstated the sequence of events in the Queens accident. According to the police, a car driven by Steven Azconza of Westbury, N.Y., struck a car driven by Melvin Santana of Queens; Mr. Santana did not strike Mr. Azconza's car. The accident killed Mr. Santana's passenger, Wendy Almonte of Queens; an earlier version of the article misidentified the victim in that accident as the driver of the second car. A reader pointed out the error involving the sequence of events in an e-mail message on Jan. 16.

A headline with an article in some copies on Dec. 24 about the death of three people in vehicular accidents in New York omitted one of the boroughs where a fatality occurred. Besides Brooklyn and Staten Island, there was a fatality in Queens. The article also misstated the sequence of events in the Queens accident. According to the police, a car driven by Steven Azconza of Westbury, N.Y., struck a car driven by Melvin Santana of Queens; Mr. Santana did not strike Mr. Azconza's car. The accident killed Mr. Santana's passenger, Wendy Almonte of Queens; an earlier version of the article misidentified the victim in that accident as the driver of the second car. A reader pointed out the error involving the sequence of events in an e-mail message on Jan. 16.
